name: New Majestic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011
reviews.text: Stayed at the hotel previously at the premier garden room. Love it, especially the outdoor bathtub. Hence this yr, decided to be different and chose a junior loft lifestyle room. The room is small and the bed is located "upstairs" where i have to climb a small flight of stairs to get to it. Not exactly recommended for those bigger in size or having knee problems. The room is not as roomy as the premier garden. I didnt have the wow factor when i enter the room, since i was here the second time, probably i was expecting more. Nonetheless, the amenities were good. they even gave us two bottles of singapore sling as complimentary when they knew it's my friend's birthday. That was a nice touch. (: breakfast in the hotel was kinda disappointing. I would expect a more variety from a 4* boutique hotel and from my point of view, the hotel seems to be cutting cost. Not sure if it's true, just my two cents worth. Should u choose this hotel, do pick the premier garden room n above. Otherwise, you might be as disappointed as i am.
reviews.title: Junior lifestyle loft is suitable for small sized individual.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed the quirky details and excellent ammenities (coffeeeee) of New Majestic. I didn't mind staying indoors when it rained heavily on Saturday. A minor disappointment was the hotel didn't have the channel that carried the French Open nor NBA finals.
reviews.title: A gem in Chinatown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was very accommodating to my husband's requests (had to have documents printed, on the spot taxi call,etc.). I personally found the cleaning staff efficient, and friendly (always with a ready smile).
reviews.title: Excellent overnight stay at this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel lived up to its promise. Very modern, individually styled rooms. The staff could not have been more friendly or helpful. Great restaurant. The room was comfortable, roomy, modern and the outdoor bath was a bit of luxury. Of course there were excellent indoor shower/WC facilities as well. It's well located in Chinatown so you are spoiled for choice with so many eating places bars and nightclubs nearby, but why go past the top flight restaurant in the hotel. We sampled two rooms as we were able to use the 'shower room' facility after a day's shopping in steamy Singapore but before the flight out. I'd recommend that 'loft' room with twin baths as well.
reviews.title: Very Unique! Enjoyed taking bath on the private veranda!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Goldfish room which was wonderful. The room was very small but there are lots of shelves. The sink is open to the room and the toilet and shower are each in frosted glass enclosures---might not be acceptable to some people. We had free internet; stuff to make tea or coffee and a refrigerator. The room and hotel were spotless. As a bonus all of the bath products are Kiehl's. The breakfast includes a buffet of pastries, breads, fruit, dumplings, rice, plus eggs/sausage or bacon made to order. It was easy for us to get to the Botanical Gardens; Little India; the Sands; and walk to China town. The hotel staff was very helpful with directions and transportation. The hotel is about a block from the entrance to the subway and we used it to get to the airport .
reviews.title: recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights after a fortnight in Bali/Lombok, and it provided a lovely end to the trip.
reviews.title: I would definitely stay here again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011
reviews.text: The staff are friendly and attentive.
reviews.title: The Power of One

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: The hotel is well designed: it has some great art, and the rooms are fun (though really quite wacky). Our room was small, but the space was brilliantly managed so it didn't feel cramped, and it had a large window with views over the pool garden which really helped The bed was very comfortable indeed! They offer free wifi, and some of the mini bar (such as soft drinks, coffee, and the like) were also free.
reviews.title: Tiles fallen off shower wall.Dissapointing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant was very good, though the menu was confusing - it was hard to tell whether the dishes were main courses in themselves, or whether they were to be shared, and indeed whether they came with rice, etc. To be honest, I'm not sure the restaurant themselves knew how they wanted you to eat the courses! In the end, we would order one each, and rice, *and* share them - neither one thing nor the other. Breakfast - complete with all the char sui buns one could eat - was excellent!
reviews.title: We love it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The location is great for tourism.
reviews.title: Interesting hotel in Chinatown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Husband and I stayed at the New Majestic for four nights, whilst stopping over en route to Sydney. I chose the hotel based on previous reviews and the price, especially when compared with other hotels in Singapore. It turned out to be a brilliant choice!
reviews.title: Awesome hotel, a real find in Singapore

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011
reviews.text: Plus points: gratis early check in, much needed after a 14 hour flight.
reviews.title: Not worth the price especially now with the nearby construction

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff could not be more helpful, patient and willing, such a nice change!
reviews.title: Great food and service but a tad bit over-priced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was small but practical, spotlessly clean, had everything we could need including an espresso machine, kettle, hairdryer, mini fridge, safe.
reviews.title: Great hotel and location, but not one of my favorites..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bathroom was incredible, HUGE shower, loads of clean fluffy towels, soft bathrobes and plenty of gorgeous toiletries from Kiehls (check out the RRP of these products, they are expensive!)
reviews.title: Gorgeous hotel, gorgeous service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed here for 5 nights in early September as two couples in two different rooms. While the rooms we had were small (pool view rooms) their funkiness made up for it. The in-room Nespressos were very much appreciated as were the terrific showers. The hot water in our room didn't last long but no matter as it was quite refreshing to have a tepid shower anyway.
reviews.title: Excellent location, staff very friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The staff were exceptionally friendly and thoughtful, the location was fabulous with an MRT only 200m away and it is in an interesting area. Easy walking distance to Chinatown. The pool view rooms were very quiet and we all slept well.
reviews.title: Great for couples, not for young family

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was terrific with a mix of styles and the dining room staff were also very friendly. We ate in the restaurant one night. The food was delicious but a bit on the pricey side.
reviews.title: Lovely small hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would I stay here again? Definitely. One caution- mind the sharp tiles on the swimming pool. Their rough edges caused my daughters expensive swimmers to rip.
reviews.title: Beautiful boutique hotel in a beautiful setting . . .

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: The hotel is a great boutique hotel set in Chinatown area, just in front of the hotels are a line of Karaoke parlors, restaurants and other entertainments on old colorful old buildings. MRT station is also located only a few hundred meters away, along with the famous Chinatown food street. The inside concept is also a blend of classic chinese with ultra modern touch, which we loved. Our room was covered from floor to ceiling with mirrors (one of them is the hidden door to the bathroom) and the bathtub was outside in the garden. Full blown modern equipments including big LCD screen, Bose stereo, modern shower system, and Nespresso machine as a nice surprise. They also have a great and complete small fitness room.
reviews.title: Great boutique hotel

description: Housed in a traditional conservation shop house located in the heart of Chinatown, the New Majestic Hotel features an emphasis on strong design, local culture and the Arts.From the open concept period-inspired lobby with restored vintage Compton fans to the dramatic pool with glass inserts floating above the restaurant, to the selection of period colonial furniture from Singapore in the 1920s- 1960s, New Majestic Hotel is a stunning and eclectic mix of heritage chic.Each of the New Majestic's 30 rooms is different, from the mix of vintage and designer furniture through to the customized baths. Room highlights include suites with private gardens, attic style rooms with loft beds in six-meter high ceilings.
